pull.title: validation: Make translations of fatal errors consistent
pull.body:
The extra `bilingual_str` argument of the fatal error notifications and `node::AbortNode()` is often unused and when used usually contains the same string as the message argument. It also seems to be confusing, since it is not consistently used for errors requiring user action. For example some assumeutxo fatal errors require the user to do something, but are not translated.

So simplify the fatal error and abort node interfaces by only passing a translated string. This slightly changes the fatal errors displayed to the user.

75ffa4fc456d898b308cf51385e20c2faf11aa42 -> 9a32540c0328268fb1cfc3105aaee596be4b6f6a ([fatallogtranslate_0](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/fatallogtranslate_0) -> [fatallogtranslate_1](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/fatallogtranslate_1), [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/fatallogtranslate_0..fatallogtranslate_1))

* Addressed @stickies-v's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29672#discussion_r1530237537), replacing `LogPrintf` with `LogError`.
* Addressed @stickies-v's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29672#discussion_r1530240008), removing leftover string include.
* Addressed @stickies-v [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29672#discussion_r1530273830), added brief context description to "System errors".

Updated 9a32540c0328268fb1cfc3105aaee596be4b6f6a -> 918efe63a685f9da4a941dd3c757ce60639e52b6 ([fatallogtranslate_1](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/fatallogtranslate_1) -> [fatallogtranslate_2](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/fatallogtranslate_2), [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/fatallogtranslate_1..fatallogtranslate_2))

* Addressed @stickies-v's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29672#discussion_r1530785665), making the abort error messages a bit more legible.
re-ACK 98d0dd92ad384990d3b63618c2473ee83a23754d - no differences but to resolve merge conflict with #27039

node: Make translations of fatal errors consistent

The extra `bilingual_str` argument of the fatal error notifications and
`node::AbortNode()` is often unused and when used usually contains the
same string as the message argument. It also seems to be confusing,
since it is not consistently used for errors requiring user action. For
example some assumeutxo fatal errors require the user to do something,
but are not translated.

So simplify the fatal error and abort node interfaces by only passing a
translated string. This slightly changes the fatal errors displayed to
the user.

Also de-duplicate the abort error log since it is repeated in noui.cpp.

since it is not consistently used for errors requiring user action. For
example some assumeutxo fatal errors require the user to do something,
but are not translated.

So simplify the fatal error and abort node interfaces by only passing a
translated string. This slightly changes the fatal errors displayed to
the user.

Also de-duplicate the abort error log since it is repeated in noui.cpp.

events.body:
Sorry for invalidating those ACKs, but I feel like this is easy enough to look at again.

98d0dd92ad384990d3b63618c2473ee83a23754d -> 824f47294a309ba8e58ba8d1da0af15d8d828f43 ([fatallogtranslate_3](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/fatallogtranslate_3) -> [fatallogtranslate_4](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/tree/fatallogtranslate_4), [compare](https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/compare/fatallogtranslate_3..fatallogtranslate_4))


* Addressed @hebasto's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29672#discussion_r1533788044), removing duplicate line.
* Added another commit using the new log functions in `noui_ThreadSafeMessageBox`. Added this because it seemed weird to go back to the old style of logging the error after the previous change.

re-ACK 824f47294a309ba8e58ba8d1da0af15d8d828f43.

A side note:
After 6 years, it seems worth reconsidering https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14655 again.

ACK 824f47294a309ba8e58ba8d1da0af15d8d828f43 🔎

comments.body:
```suggestion
    LogError("%s\n", message.original);
```

And potentially the same a few lines down, even though it's currently not touched.

nit: while touching, would be useful to consistently add context (+[here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29672/files#diff-97c3a52bc5fad452d82670a7fd291800bae20c7bc35bb82686c2c0a4ea7b5b98R4986))
```suggestion
        return FatalError(GetNotifications(), state, strprintf(_("System error while writing block to history file: %s"), e.what()));
```
nit: by using `LogError`, we're already adding an `[error]` prefix so I think "Error: " could be removed, as could the "***" a few lines up imo

While this code is touched, the `LogError` call seems redundant as the following `InitError` logs the `message` unconditionally:
```
2024-03-21T12:08:54Z [error] Flushing block file to disk failed. This is likely the result of an I/O error.
2024-03-21T12:08:54Z Error: A fatal internal error occurred, see debug.log for details: Flushing block file to disk failed. This is likely the result of an I/O error.
```
It's the uiInterface that logs it. I think if you run `bitcoin-qt`, there should be no redundant log line.

> It's the uiInterface that logs it. I think if you run `bitcoin-qt`, there should be no redundant log line.

When running the GUI, the log line redundancy remains :)
Oh, not sure why I got that impression then. This should be fixed.
